segments.text: I see a woman drying dishes, completely oblivious to the water overflowing from the sink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The puddle is spreading right under her feet, but she doesn’t even flinch.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the children sneaking cookies behind her back, and it’s almost funny how unaware she is.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is standing on a wobbly stool, reaching for the cookie jar like it’s the most important thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the girl is waiting for her share, her hand outstretched like a little bird begging for crumbs.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene feels like a disaster waiting to happen, but no one seems to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the woman will ever notice the mess or the mischief.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so peaceful, but inside, chaos is brewing.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how calm everything seems when it’s clearly falling apart.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool is about to tip, and the water is still running—someone needs to intervene.
segments.speaker: PAR
